doc.str: Method of treating at a high-temperature waste liquid from production plant for hydrocarbons or oxygen-containing compounds

A method of treating organic matter-containing waste liquid, which is formed as a byproduct in a plant for the production of oxygen-containing compounds or liquid hydrocarbons (including liquid fuel oil and chemicals, which are produced from natural gas through a synthetic gas), having the step of: treating the waste liquid at a high temperature of 40.degree. C. or higher, while being aerated, by using a membrane bioreactor (2) that is equipped with a separation membrane (7b).
"Haisuishori no Seibutsugaku (Biology of Waste Liquid Treatment)", by Ryu-ichi Sudo, Sangyo Yosui Chosakai, Jun. 12, 1977--Excerpted English Translation. cited by other.
TOYO ENGINEERING CORPORATION (CHIYODA-KU, TOKYO, JP), WATER RE-USE PROMOTION CENTER (CHUO-KU, TOKYO, JP), EBARA CORPORATION
